Body:
I have a requirement in my aws IoT project in which I need to udpate aws IoT connected device's application code or some part of it, let's say, application version or application schedule updation etc.
How should I achieve this ? so far I could found cloud front or code deploy useful but not directly used for such purposes. Any other service would help me in achieving the required solution available in aws ?
Thanks.

If you are using an android device then you can use an AsyncTask to fetch the latest from an S3 bucket and call the post download method to install the apk refer the answer @ the link

https://stackoverflow.com/a/15213350/7328096

"
its also helpful . I need to test it .

Firmware upgrade on all devices

A reasonable pattern would be to use the Device Shadow in AWS IoT to store in the reported state
column9:
the current firmware information of your device.

{	  "reported": {	    "firmware": {	      "version": "1.0.0"
column10:
"name": "linux-3.8.0-armeabi" } } }

When you want to trigger a firmware upgrade on your devices
column11: you can reference the new version
column12:
and a pointer to it (to an S3 bucket for instance) in the desired state.

{	  "reported": {	    "firmware": {	      "version": "1.0.0"
column17: the device will receive a delta event
column18: indicating a change in its shadow document
column19:
and will start downloading the new firmware once he'll notice that a new firmware entry is described in the desired state.

Note: One advantage of this method is that it will work even if the devices are offline
column21:
they will sync with the shadow.

Selective firmware upgrade

Sometimes
column22: manufacturers want to control the way firmwares are being deployed on their device fleet
column23:
for example they may want to:

  • Deploy different firmwares for different regions in the world.
  • Deploy different firmwares for devices having slightly different hardware.
  • Deploy different firmwares for devices they have sold to different manufacturers (B2B2C).
  • Deploy a firmware progressively across different regions
column24:
and not at the same time.

To take these contraints into account if you want to fine-grain your deployment
column25: you can use the above method coupled to the use of Things Attributes in the Device Registry
column26: so that when you are going to update the desired state
column27:
you will do so by only selecting the devices matching predefined attributes.

"

Body: ok . thanks for the detailed answer. I also heard that updating the android device code without human intervention is tricky as there is lot of security related issues. I will get back to you once I am done with the above given steps and face any challenge. thanks.
